ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sustainable Livelihood Program Training Program on Terra-cotta funded Council for Advancement of People and Rural Technology (CAPART-A cell of Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India) â€¢ Supported by CAPART, Regional cell, Uttar Pradesh (North Zone) of Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India under ARTS scheme. â€¢ The program has been being implemented in 4 villages of Block-Chinahat, Uttar Pradesh, India. â€¢ The Project Title is â€œThe Enhancement in the Basic Skill of Terra cotta, its Diversification and Decorationâ€ â€¢ We started the program initially with 50 Beneficiaries. Training Program on Embroidery (Handicraft) â€¢ The organization is working in 2 GPs of Bakshi-Ka-Talab, District-Lucknow and 1 GP of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki with embroidery artisans to make them more competitive and sustainable. â€¢ SRIJANA is working with artisans to assist them in such a way that they become able establish their own unit which will provide self employment. â€¢ Women artisans are the main focus of our intervention. â€¢ We are doing continuous market research to assist our artisans to become more compatible to get better market accessibility. Natural Resource Management NEAC Program (Climate Change, Household Composting, Plantation and Rural Energy) funded by Indian Environment Society (A Cell under Ministry of Environment and Forest) â€¢ Supported by Indian Environment Society (A Cell under Ministry of Environment and Forest). â€¢ NEAC program Organized in Baksi Ka Talab covering 4 GPs, Uttar Pradesh, India. â€¢ Climate Change, Household Composting, Plantation and Rural Energy have been the major theme of project intervention. â€¢ Mass awareness and technology demonstration have been one of our important activities. Sustainable Scientific and Advanced Agriculture Technology Dissemination Program â€¢ The organization is working in 6 villages of 3 GPs of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki in Uttar Pradesh, India. â€¢ The Farmers Technology Dissemination Groups have been established in the village for various techniques, training and demonstrations. â€¢ Small and Marginal Famers are the major target for project intervention. â€¢ To promote the eco-friendly sustainable agriculture with decreasing cost of cultivation and enhancing production etc are the main focus of our intervention. Disaster Management Awareness Program â€¢ We are organizing camp, workshop, meeting in our operational area. â€¢ We started the Program by analyzing our aims and objectives to the community leader, Gram Pradhans, PRI members, CBOS to prepare the community to fight from these sudden changes being happen in our Environment. Water Harvesting and Water Conservation Program â€¢ In order to mitigate the scarcity of water for both the purposes drinking and Irrigation the organization is working in the area of water conservation and water harvesting the organization is working in 2 GPs of Block-Sidhauli, Distirict-Sitapur and 3 GPs of Block-Nindura, District-Barabanki in Uttar Pradesh, India. â€¢ The training on techniques being imparted are based on improving the efficiency of water use, and by reducing its loss due to evaporation, we can reduce water demand. Program on Alternative Energy Resources â€¢ SRIJANA is working on alternative energy like Biomass, Bio-gas Plant, Solar Power, cultivation of Bio-energy resources to mitigate the scarcity using local resources. â€¢ Community sensitization, Technology demonstration and Technology Dissemination are the main focus of our activities. Health Hygiene and Sanitation Protection of Aids Awareness Program â€¢ We are rendering our services in the area of awareness generation about STDs/HIV/AIDS, Counseling for improving Couple Relationship, Condom Promotion and distribution of literature etc through One to One and One to Group, Audio visual shows, Street Plays, Panchayat Sensitization Program and various other methods. â€¢ SRIJANA has been implementing a comprehensive HIV/AIDS prevention program through targeted interventions with the mobile population of truckers and their families CSWs, MSMs, the transgender population and young people. Promotion of Naturopathy Yoga, Proper Nutrition and Revitalization of Tradition Health System Program â€¢ The organization is consistently working in the field Naturopathy, Yoga, Proper Nutrition & Revitalization of Traditional Health System at it registered office and in the operational area. â€¢ We are serving the community through organizing camp, workshop, counseling, audio-visual show and distributing literature. â€¢ Naturopathy is a system of therapy and treatment which relies exclusively on natural remedies, such as sunlight, air, water, supplemented with diet and therapies such as massage. â€¢ The one of the main objectives of our interventions is to strengthen the healing ability. Family Planning and Reproductive Child Health Program â€¢ SRIJANA is working with community in its operational area to aware them about various method of contraception for a small, economically and socially sustainable family. â€¢ We are working with our community to develop better system of pre and post maternal care. â€¢ One of the major objectives of the intervention is to decrease the child mortality and abnormalities. â€¢ SRIJANA is mobilizing the community to become more sensitive towards the care of pregnant woman to get a healthy child. Total Sanitation and Rural Hygiene Awareness Program â€¢ The organization is working in 2 GPs of Block-Chinhat, District-Lucknow and 2 GPs of Nindura, District-Barabanki on â€œTotal Sanitation Campaign (TSC)â€. â€¢ SRIJANA emphasizes more on Information, Education and Communication (IEC), capacity development of community and awareness generation. Women and Child Welfare Program Women Empowerment Program â€¢ SRIJANA has realized that no change can be brought in until we include women empowerment in our every program. â€¢ Women have been major beneficiaries of our interventions those who are disadvantaged, marginalized and in difficult circumstances. â€¢ The organization is rendering its services through camps, workshop and training programs. â€¢ SRIJANA mobilizing the women community in order to become aware about their rights, economically and socially viable. Integrated Program for Street and Working Children â€¢ SRIJANA are working with the children having no homes and family ties, Children living in slums, children of sex workers and children of pavement dwellers. â€¢ We support these children for providing shelter, nutrition, health care, sanitation and hygiene, safe drinking water, education and recreational facilities and protection against abuse and exploitation. Other Program Interventions â€¢ Integrated Development Program for OBC/SC/ST â€¢ Promotion of Culture and Traditional Art â€¢ Consumer Awareness Program â€¢ Promotion of Youth and Adolescent Activities â€¢ Handicapped Welfare Program â€¢ Protection of Human Rights

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities - (1) Curriculum & Material Preparation in the area of Literacy and its allign subjects. (2) Training and Orientation of Literacy Functionaries. (3) Research Evaluation and Monitoring of Literacy Programme and other projects, conducts impact studies. (4) Organize general activities like - Financial Literacy, Legal Literacy, Environmental Literacy, etc. Achievements - (1) During 2013-14 SRC, U.P. had been assigned responsibility of organising Island of Success. There were 5 districts namely - Basti, Deoria, Fatehpur, Unnao and Varanasi undertaken. 627 Villages of adopted 5 districts. Initial target was to literate 3,39,936 persons whereas 2,99,990 had been made successfully literate. As an outcome 90% success achieved. (2) During 2014-15 special drive were organised in Pachpedwa Block of District Balrampur and Gilaula Block of District Shravasti. Initial target was 3000 in each Block. As an outcome 100% success had been achieved during 2014-15. (3) SRC, U.P. had initiated an innovative Campaign first time in entire country Suraksha Bandhan Video Rath Yatra. As an outcome 95042 number of persons were covered. (4) Live Video Coverage of Suraksha Bandhan Rath Yatra had been included in the NLMA documentary Suraksha Se Samajik Suraksha included in the NLMA documentary displayed on the occassion of International Literacy Day on 8th September 2015 in Vigyan Bhavan, New Delhi. (5) As per NLMA instruction SRC, U.P. had been assigned to initiate action for 100% Literacy in SAGY Villages. SRC, U.P. had adopted 30 SAGY Villages out of 93 SAGY Villages in entire U.P. during 2015-16. The initial target was 17,718 as an output 14,240 successfully appeared. Highest target was adopted in all SRCs. Outstanding activities like - Training of DC, BC and Preraks of entire 93 SAGY Villages and distribution of publicity material were also given. (6) Puppet Shows, Street Plays, Awareness Rallies, Wall Writing and Coordination meetings were undertaken as a massive campaign to make conducive environment for achieving 100% literacy target. (7) State Literacy Award 2016 was given to 10 Preraks of SRC, U.P. adopted SAGY Villages in the district of Varanasi, Chandauli, Mahoba, Mathura, etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Organization "Susanskriti" is registered organization working in the field of urban and rural development and socially equality since 2011. Organization mainly focus on wome and child development in the society, cast and creed is the bigest problem in our society but organization working for every children and women who wants to development for their better life. Organization believe on our constitution which give every India right to education and the development itself. Organization help them who wants to do something through education and hard working. Sunsanskriti has always worked for t he women and children as well as the society, organization is motivating people for sustainable development of income generation activities for their livelihood. Since most of the Allahabad district women has no proper solution for employment organization always help them through the training programme which is help to them self employment. The important of value addition education for slum children and BPL community women produce reaches up to a significant level for the livelihood of the community.

ngoList.address: SW TAPESHWAR RAM KALYAN SAMITIMOHALLA - SAIDPURPOST - MOHAMMADABAD GOHNA DISTT MAU PIN CODE 276403
ngoList.title: SW TAPESHWAR RAM KALYAN SAMITI MOH SAIDPUR MOHAMMADABAD GOHNA MAU
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The main object of Sw. Tapeshwar Ram Kalyan Samiti Saidpur PO. Mohammadabad Gohna Dist. Mau is to educate the society to do work for the promotion of welfare of women , children and old age people to provide vocational training for removal of unemployment to establish social and national values in the society and to eradicate social ills and bad habit spread out in our society . In the year 1990 the above named society was established being influenced with the above object. The society was registered on 30-11-1990 under the provision of Society Reg Act 1860 with its registration number 1039/1990-91. The Society was renewed on 29-11-2015 for the period of five year i.e. it is valid upto 28-11-2020. Having obtained its legal validity the society had done so many drastic efforts in the following fields . A- Educationl Work :- An Intermediate college namely National Public Welfare Inter College , Chistipatti (hafizpur) Mau has been established under the society to teach the students of class VI to XII from 1994. From this college 2509 students were being benefited in 2015-16 and 2210 students are studying in the present session 2017-17. A primary level school named as Rashtriya Janta Primary School Chistipatti is working to educated the small children. 325 students (from I to V ) were being educated in the year 2015-16 and 2210 students are taking primary education in the current session 2016-17. B- Residential educational Institutions :- The society runs a residential primary school in Moh - Saidpur Teh- Mohammadabad Gohna Distt. Mau in a rental building w.e.f. 1993-94 where 100 students are taking their primary education properly every year. The ministry of social justice and empowerment Govt. of India provides annual grant from 1993-94 onwards upto 2015-16. For the year 2014-15 the above mentioned ministry has allotted 2112300.00 in favor of our society by its authority letter number 11020(18)/16/2013 SCD III dated 04-03-216. The grant has been utilized under the provision of the ministry. C- Skilled training work :- 40 students of SC/St are given sklled training program at Mohammadabad Gohna Dist. Mau W.E.F. 01-07-1999. This is a Type and Short Hand School for SC/ST students. The ministry of social justice and empowerment Govt. of India has sanctioned necessary grant from 2001-2002 every year. 40 unemployed ladies has been benifitted with necessary employment providing them Embroidery, Cutting and Tailoring . D- Extra curricular activities : The educational institution running under the society are providing not only curricular education but extra curricular activities like games, sports and debates. Debates are centered on the life and work of leader like Baba Saheb and Mahtma Phuley. The students enjoy the tourist spot of Mahatma Buddha in every year tour . E- Other Social Work : The society has been fighting against the bad evils spread out in our community. The person who are taking liquor or addict of wine are being treated with the help of psychologists and a medical team hired by the society- Game - sports and cultural programmes are conducted every month on different occasion Wollen blanket were distributed amount 180 old age persons and Sarees-Shals were distributed among 150 old age women in 2014-15. An old age home (non-residential) of 50 member has been conducted by the society without any caste and class discrimination. Divyangs (Disabled persons) are being benifited with skill training programmes organized by the society .
